description:
Lead Data Scientist (Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Artificial Intelligence, NLP)Want to change the world? My client, working at the global hub of hardcore analytics, is on the lookout for individuals passionate about developing technologies that will have real-life implications across various industries. If you’re an accomplished Data Scientist, passionate about reshaping the future and driven by embracing the unknown then please read on.You will research, incubate and pilot new and emerging digital technologies. You will be building the future in real time, partnering with blue-chip clients at the forefront of various industries. The successful Lead Data Scientist (Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Artificial Intelligence, NLP) will be operating across all stages of the innovation spectrum; the working environment will be open and interactive. Despite being a globally established management consultancy my client has a real start-up feel, allowing their consultants to thrive in culture full of creativity and experimentation.Lead Data Scientist (Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Artificial Intelligence, NLP)Key ResponsibilitiesWorking on various machine learning and cognitive computing projects; building algorithms into software, and conducting experiments.Contributing to the development of the Analytics practice by designing and implementing new business processes and strategies.Work across the entire project lifecycle, developing the design, identifying potential pitfalls and implementing creative solutions.Liaising with senior stakeholders, explaining how new technologies can impact daily lifeBuilding client relationships and your network across the practice.Leading and managing small teams of data scientists, data engineers and developers to deliver client projects.The successful Lead Data Scientist (Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Artificial Intelligence, NLP) will have:Experience across the following: machine learning, statistical modeling, data mining, big data, cognitive computing, deep learning, artificial intelligence, unstructured data analytics.Proficiency in statistical and other tools/languages, R, RevR, SAS, Python or similarExperience working with large data sets and tools like MapReduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark or similarAbility to work in a global collaborative team environmentAn excellent academic record, with a degree in a related scientific discipline.A subject matter expertise in one of the following Analytic tools: SAS, SPSS, R, Revolution R, MatlabA passion for Data Science!This is a unique opportunity for Lead Data Scientist (Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Artificial Intelligence, NLP) who wants to move away from the corporate environment and wants to enhance their career by taking on a team of innovators, and lead them to large scale innovation.Location: DublinSalary: €75,000 - €110,000Length: Permanent Contact: Shaun KettTelephone: 020 7780 6700 E-mail: Start: FlexibleReference: AMC*SKE/7893

description:
Data Centre Migrations Analyst - Contract Data Centre Migrations Analyst required for this very large end user to identify within the applications estate which applications to migrate. You will be experienced in the discovery of application footprints and the establishment of application roadmaps as to determine the migration and remediation approach. You will analyse applications to help optimise the application landscape. Estimate effort, cost, benefit, priority and contribute to the business case to enable delivery by the relevant migration teams. Assist with management of migrations. Some of your key accountabilities will be: Assist in creation of business case, take responsibility for data centre discovery to quickly identify applications, their owners and the corresponding infrastructure footprint. Engage with Application Owners, contribute to the development of a comprehensive application inventory - making updates and amendments as required. Produce regular reports on the application landscape to senior stakeholders. Coordinate cost and benefit identification, assessment and tracking related to data centres, applications and associated infrastructure. Co-ordinate the assessment of applications to understand their roadmaps and options to retire; this will include working with Application Owners and Enterprise Architecture alike to understand potential replacement solutions. Identify the most appropriate remediation and migration approach in line with the roadmap established. Identify overall prioritisation and effort estimation to inform delivery planning. Build an overall programme plan bottom up by working with individual project managers. Technical skills and experience. Experience with 2+ Data Centre migrations within a Regulated Environment. Excellent analytical skills - ability to interpret and manage large data sets. Good Communication skills. Windows Server, Linux, VMWare, Oracle, SQL, Tomcat, and Apache. Understanding of network technologies, application tiering and distributed architectures. Dell Server, EMC VNX, XIO Storage, Secure Copy, Double Take, VEEAM, Platespin. description:
Ascential is an international business-to-business media company. We inform and connect business professionals in more than 150 countries through market-leading Exhibitions & Festivals and Information Services. Ascential powers the prestigious Cannes Lions festival for the branded communications industry, the world’s premier market leading payments and financial services innovation congress Money 20/20, the UK’s largest trade show Spring/Autumn Fair, the global fashion trend forecasting service WGSN and environmental data business Groundsure. 22 of Ascential’s 31 product lines are market leading and are number one in their respective markets. We exist to provide customers with world class content and connections empowering their businesses to be the best informed and best connected. description:
Senior Data ScientistThe quality of data at comparethemarket.com makes a huge difference to the experience of our customers and the success of the business. We are currently looking for an exceptionally talented and passionate Senior Data Scientist to join our team and work closely with product engineering teams to identify development opportunities, strategies and architect plans, and develop algorithmic solutions.We are looking for someone who can generate valuable and actionable insights by utilising advanced statistical techniques and data mining approaches to improve decision making. Also analysing and interpreting the results of new product development experiments, with the ability to communicate the findings to key stakeholders, gaining support and ‘buy in’ for any recommendations.The roleAs a Senior Data Scientist you will build well maintained models of customer behaviours that influence programmatic decision making. Then evolve and enhance systems and tools for agile data analysis and visualisation.You will ensure systematic leverage of insight explorations and analyses for repeated use of knowledge, improve our speed of response to insight needs and improve our overall maturity in data and advance analytics capabilities.The role requires professional networking with current and potential data providers through appropriate attendance at industry and market events. You will also be actively involved in our people agenda by up-skilling our existing analyst base and helping to shape future requirements.What will it take?As a highly skilled, professional and confident Senior Data Scientist, you’ll have excellent analytical and problem solving skills. You will have a strong passion for empirical research and for answering hard questions with data.You will also have stats and data analysis experience working with advanced tools like R, SAS, or alike, along with strong capability in advanced statistics for example; multiple regression, GLM’s, Monte Carlo simulation, clustering (e.g. K-means) and machine learning techniques.Why choose us?The benefits package is excellent and comprehensive; you’ll earn a competitive salary with an annual bonus, private medical cover and a range of benefits that you’d expect from a great employer. Perhaps more importantly in this role you’ll have the opportunity to work with some outstanding people in a fun and thriving environment.What next?If you can see yourself succeeding in this role, it would be great to hear from you. The first step is to click apply.


Contact: Recruitment Team
        

Reference: CWJobs/2555

description:
About AIM:Cognizant’s Analytics & Information Management (AIM) Practice has over 28,000 Data professionals globally with approximately 4,000 working on UK client projects. AIM covers the full spectrum of client information requirements from the most basic management of application data stores through every aspect of Data Governance on to Big Data including every Analytical & Insight requirement and the complete information infrastructure for every Digital business initiative.We are now looking for a highly talented technologist, who can help maintain our success as leaders within global Payments solutions and accelerate our efforts to become a major part of the future of Payments and Digital Money. To considered, the successful individual must have background in innovation including design thinking, prototyping and also have solid commercial awareness.Summary of Job Purpose:Be a part of the dynamic, next generation digital banking solution, which will significantly enhance the way we provide global, banking services to our clients. You will work with the latest technologies on one of the largest corporate digital banking systems.You will have the opportunity to learn about various digital banking technologies and Corporate Cash Management business.Job Content:Design, develop and support high performing transactional risk management platform.Help facilitate software quality measures – TDD, Peer Review, continuous integration and unit test.Take ownership for the creating very high quality code that you would be proud of.Deal with wider team in the software development life-cycle – PMs, BAs and validationWork with the Application and Domain experts to fulfill the project key success factors.Key experience required:Doctorate Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Math, or related disciplinesHigh motivation to achieve ambitious goals in a short time. Curiosity and passion for Data ScienceExperience in machine learningExperience in data analyticsExperience tackling problems involving Big Data, e.g., using the Spark/Hadoop stackExperience using Python, R, C/C++, Java or Scala for large scale data analyticsEnglish: Fluent About Cognizant:Cognizant (NASDAQ: CTSH) is a leading provider of information technology, consulting, and business process outsourcing services, dedicated to helping the world's leading companies build stronger businesses. Headquartered in Teaneck, New Jersey (U.S.), Cognizant combines a passion for client satisfaction, technology innovation, deep industry and business process expertise, and a global, collaborative workforce that embodies the future of work. With over 100 development and delivery centres worldwide and approximately 255,800 employees as of September 30, 2016, Cognizant is a member of the NASDAQ-100, the S&P 500, the Forbes Global 2000, and the Fortune 500 and is ranked among the top performing and fastest growing companies in the world. Visit us online at www.cognizant.com or follow us on Twitter: Cognizant.

description:
Role: Data ScientistSalary: £55,000 to £75,000 + Car Allowance + BonusLocation: Slough, BerkshireOur client, a global Powerhouse within the Pharmaceutical/Life Sciences industry, are currently building their Data Science team within their drug discovery area. We are currently looking to speak to experienced individuals that have relevant experience and the desire to change lives throughout the world. In this role, you will be responsible for accelerating drug discovery by enhancing their decision making process, working with a wide range of scientists to extract actionable insights from complex data sets. From there, you will build predictive models from disparate data sets, uncover patterns in high-density data, and make those insights impactful thanks to a thorough understanding of the drug discovery process. Skills & ExperienceYou will have demonstrable experience for mathematics, statistics, signal processing, image analysis, machine learning, data mining, and data visualization.Deep knowledge of Scripting and analytics software, including R, Python, Pipeline Pilot or KNIME, Tableau, or Spotfire.Fluent in big data management tools, Hadoop, NoSQL datastores as well more traditional relational databases Demonstrable expertise in Machine Learning toolkits and major programming frameworksGood understanding of Deep Learning and Natural Language Processing is desirable.Good understanding of Biology, Chemistry, and Drug Discovery is required.If you are interested in this, or similar Data Science opportunities, please apply today so that a member of the RBW Consulting team can be in contact to discuss this further.


Contact: Chris Sinclair
        

Reference: CWJobs/CS - DDDS03022017

description:
Data ScientistHitachi Consulting is the global business and IT consulting company of Hitachi Ltd and is recognised as a leader in delivering proven business strategies and technology solutions. Hitachi Consulting offers the agility of a smaller firm, the stability of a larger firm and the innovation that comes from being part of the global Hitachi group.With a balanced view of strategy, people, process and technology, Hitachi Consulting works with organisations to understand their unique business needs, and to develop and implement solutions that provide measurable value quickly through the inspired work of great people.Practice OverviewThe growth of big data means that our customers are looking to derive further insight and opportunities from their existing systems, and to utilise advanced data driven software algorithms to improve and optimise their businesses. To meet this need, the Information Management (IM) practice of Hitachi Consulting is establishing a Data Science and Machine Learning team that is able to bring added value to existing and future projects. An opportunity exists for an ambitious and creative Data Scientist to join the practice and take a leading role in defining opportunities and delivering best-in-class solutions as part of a multi-disciplinary team of software and industry experts.ResponsibilitiesSuccessful candidates will recognise that the core of their skill set is formed through the pragmatic application of their technical expertise, allied to an ability to express their opinions to decision makers and problem solve.The main areas of responsibility are:To identify opportunities for how advanced technologies in the data science and machine learning space can benefit existing and future projectsTo develop and deliver data-driven solutions and ML algorithms as part of an overall team, or working under your own supervisionTo apply logical common sense pragmatism in order to understand and address Business requirements with appropriate technology choicesTo be able to present complex technical concepts and ideas in a business forum appropriately To assist the sales team on occasional pre-sales opportunitiesTaking accountability and responsibility for delivering consistently professional grade work to targets and on budget with a high level of professionalismBackgroundWe hire professionals who are passionate about the benefits that technology can bring to the business. You will be excited about the new opportunities that exist in this space and keen to bring new technologies to market. The successful candidate will have a number of the following attributes: A top degree (and possibly PhD) from a top university in engineering, computer science, physics, maths or similarExtensive knowledge of machine learning techniques including regression, classification, neural networks and clusteringResearch and/or development experience in working with large data setsStrong software abilities in Python, Scala, C++ or similarExperience working with SQL and No-SQL databases, data visualization technologies and cloud infrastructure platformsA love of working in an agile development environmentCreativity combined with a pragmatic problem solving abilityTravelWhilst Hitachi Consulting is respectful of our employees work / life balance candidates should be fully prepared to travel throughout the UK and internationally if required. Hitachi Consulting offers excellent benefits and career growth to all employees and is an equal opportunity employer.Hitachi Consulting offers excellent benefits and career growth to all employees and is an equal opportunity employer.About UsHitachi Consulting is the global business and IT consulting company of Hitachi Ltd and is recognised as a leader in delivering proven business strategies and technology solutions. HC offers the agility of a smaller firm, the stability of a larger firm and the innovation that comes from being part of the global Hitachi group.With a balanced view of strategy, people, process and technology, Hitachi Consulting works with organisations to understand their unique business needs, and to develop and implement solutions that provide measurable value quickly through the inspired work of great people.Hitachi Consulting offers excellent benefits and career growth to all employees. We are an equal opportunity employer.


Contact: Hitachi Recruiting
